dialogues.text: I'll design it with you! Nick and Paris high five. Toula smiles at Paris.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIET
dialogues.text: Rodney, don’t you have a client who owns flower shops?

dialogues.speaker: RODNEY
dialogues.text: No. Oh, wait, let me think!

dialogues.speaker: HARRIET
dialogues.text: I’m sure you told me, flowers!

dialogues.speaker: RODNEY
dialogues.text: Oh yes, funeral homes!

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: Perfect! Okay, what else?

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: You all want to do this? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUNT FREIDA/UNCLE TAKI/HARRIET
dialogues.text: Of course./Yes!/You bet. Paris sees her mom is touched.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Thank you! Maybe everyone could pick a category: food, glassware-- Aunt Voula interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: The wedding is on! Pick a category and report to me. I’m in charge! 69 Everyone immediately breaks into groups, talks LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Actually Thea, you’re not--

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s best--

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: I don’t--

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: It’s what everyone wants, dear. Ian nudges Toula.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: On this beautiful May day, in slo-mo, a la The Right Stuf Maria and Gus are beaming as they, and the FAMILY power w They are of course led by Aunt Voula, holding her iPad hi showing the Walking App step-count to all behind her. Toula, Ian and the FAMILY walk and animatedly plan the wedding by sharing lists, pictures of flowers and cakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris sits on the grass, eats lunch. She watches Bennett leaning against a tree. But Bennett is watching cool girl, Tiahn, as she unwraps sandwich. Suddenly, he walks up to her --

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Tiahn, will you go to prom with me? SFX: Drum banging. From behind Tiahn, banging a drum, Clifford comes from school. TWO FRIENDS play a recorder and ukelele. EVERYONE on the grass watches as they get to Tiahn, stop playing. Clifford loudly declares.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD
dialogues.text: Tiahn, will you go to prom with me? Tommy, as usual, talks too loud.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Oh my Buddhah! You’re both asking her to prom! Clifford cocks his head at Tommy, gets it, looks past Tia at Bennett.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD
dialogues.text: Bennett, why are you asking my girlfriend to prom?

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Girlfriend?! Bennett’s mouth goes dry. STUDENTS watch. It’s clear he didn’t know they were dating.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you were --

dialogues.speaker: TIAHN
dialogues.text: (kindly) We just started dating.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Harsh. (loving the awkwardness) So Tiahn, who are you going to prom with? Bennett or Clifford, your booooyfriend? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tiahn smiles kindly to Bennett, then turns to Clifford.

dialogues.speaker: TIAHN
dialogues.text: Yes Clifford, I will go to prom with you. EVERYONE watches Clifford and Tiahn embrace. Bennett does know what to do, his feet are glued to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Ooh Bennett, walk away, dude. It’s not too late to change schools. Without thinking, in a huge burst of bravery, Paris stand and walks toward Bennett. Paris taps Bennett’s arm, he turns.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Will you go to prom with me? What feels like the entire school is watching. Bennett is stunned. Paris is embarrassed. Then--

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Well, yeah! Paris is beyond relieved. The drama over, students walk away. Paris shakes Bennett’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Great. Um, I'll pick you up--

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: No, I‘’1l pick you up. Bennett leans into Paris.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that same three-way hug, Toula and Ian have their arms wrapped around ecstatic Paris.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: I’ve never done anything like that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It’s brave.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: I heard I come from a long line of strong women.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: You do.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: But Prom is on the 20th.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: You're going to miss your grandparents’ wedding.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: That sentence doesn’t make sense.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It’s okay sweetie, prom is important. Toula and Ian keep hugging her. Paris steels

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Guys?

dialogues.speaker: TOULA/IAN
dialogues.text: Yes?/Uh huh?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: I want to go to New York University. 72 herself. Toula and Ian look at each other, what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: In the dark and quiet room, Toula sits in the armchair, u about Paris’s decision. It’s not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a beautiful June day.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Aunt Voula orders everyone around. LOUD VOICES YELL in Greek as a TENT goes up LOPSIDED behi the Portokalos home. Angelo and his business partner PATR 30's, help with the tent.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: Higher. Use your man-muscles. Nick and GRANDCHILDREN paint the fence blue and white stripes. Angelo wheels by with a GIANT HOMEMADE WEDDING CAKE. Aunt Voula sticks her finger in the cake.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DANCING ZORBA’S KITCHEN —- SAME DAY Toula, melancholy, sifts powdered sugar onto kourambiedes She knows she can’t tell the family Paris’s news. Toula glances at Ilaria, holding her BABY. Around her, the kitchen is alive with preparations. Pots of meat stew simmer, fat noodles are cooked, bechame sauce is stirred. Athena layers filo dough, brushes it with butter. Aunt Freida mixes a large vat of spinach and feta cheese. Marianthi runs by with a pot of honey and orange rinds. Jennie runs the other way with a mixing bowl of yeasty do Mana-Yiayia sits in the corner online gambling on an iPad Nick turns to see Angelo come in, explaining the kitchen his partner Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO
dialogues.text: After the wedding, you pack everything, bring it back. The pans go here... Patrick nods, takes an inventory of pans. Now Nick overhears:

dialogues.speaker: MARIANTHI
dialogues.text: What’s wrong, Toula? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Marianthi is too close. Toula quickly covers.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Nothing! It’s okay. It’s a big day. Nick puts pans of moussaka by the door. Angelo pokes Nick

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO
dialogues.text: (whispers) What’s up with Toula?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I dunno. But she’1l tell me eventually. Angelo puts foil covers on pans.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because why keep a secret from your own family? That lands. Angelo slowly turns around, looks at Nick. Nick’s eyes are kind. Angelo realizes Nick knows. Angelo feels Aunt Voula beside him and turns to her. Aunt Voula points to Patrick as he walks out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: He’s your partner. Or your partner? Angelo takes a moment, then without shame:

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO
dialogues.text: He’s both. Aunt Voula’s eyes are warm, she nods.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: I know. Suddenly, the iPad rings, Mana-Yiayia holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT FREIDA
dialogues.text: It’s Maria on The Facetimes. Toula runs over.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: What do you need? Maria appears -- at Nikki’s salon -- on the iPad. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Where are you? Who is going to curla all your hairs? Nikki leans in from behind Maria.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Everyone get over here!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HAIRDRESSER’S SALON - SAME DAY The women eat and laugh. Marianthi washes Jennie’s hair, they laugh and comment on everything. With a pen, Mana- Yiayia fills out the COSMOPOLITAN Sex Quiz. Toula (curlers in her hair) rolls curlers into Paris’s ha as Paris hands gifts to Maria. Nikki does Maria’s hair while Maria opens gifts, reads ca

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: “With love from Peter.” Maria takes another card. CLOSE-UP: writing on large card: With love from Dominique xoxo MARIA (CONT’D) “With love from Dominique, xoxo.” Who's Xoxo? She shows the “xoxo” on the card. Nikki sprays olde timey hair spray onto Maria’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: One more layer and your hair won't move until your next wedding. Nikki laughs at her own joke. Toula ducks as Nikki lacque Paris’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And this'll last ‘til you graduate college. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUNT FREIDA
dialogues.text: Paris, I hear for college you're staying in Chicago -- that’s good. 76 Toula and Paris lock eyes, Toula shakes her head - not to

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: You look pretty for your big day, Yiayia! Paris hugs Maria.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT FREIDA
dialogues.text: On my wedding day, I was too excited to eat and I fainted.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: That was our mother’s advice to us for our wedding night.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Yes! She said, if you're nervous about your duties, just pretend to faint. Your husband will take it from there.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: I did it. Everyone laughs. AUNT VOULA (CONT’D) I waited for Taki to scoop me up. But he just put a blanket on me, I slept on the cold floor by myself!

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Remember Paris, not until your wedding night. Tonight, you protect the poulaki. Toula shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Okay Mom, you said it, now let’s move on.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: There’s more.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Of course. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Toula nudges Paris.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you leave the car running?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Paris walks out, Maria calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Paris, your eyes open, your knees shut.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: And you, if your knees are open, shut your eyes. Aunt Voula and Maria cackle.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT FREIDA
dialogues.text: I always have my eyes shut tight.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: Not me! I pretend Taki is a vampire from those movies. Sometimes he likes me to dress up like a wizard. He has a magic wand

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Oh good, the sex stories are starting, let me get a better seat. Toula runs out. Nikki looks at the time, shoos out the cousins.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Everyone go get dressed! Everyone scrambles to run out. Aunt Voula follows.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: Pluck your eyebrow! Mana-Yiayia tosses her magazine, starts to head out.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Mana-Yiayia, have a seat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mana-Yiayia grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick drives up in a truck marked PET-CETERA. Angelo ba out a rack of poofy wedding dresses, wheels it up the Portokalos driveway. Toula (hair in curlers) parks in her driveway, Paris (hai curlers) jumps out and runs into the house. Toula sees the Mail Carrier leaving the Portokalos mailbo and on a hunch, runs over to grab the mail. Toula sees: the letter from Find Your Ancestry. Oh no, no today.... She tucks it into her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s quiet. Angelo goes through a rack, hands a tux to Ia

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO
dialogues.text: This should fit. Ian holds it up to himself -- it’s short. And there’s glitter on the lapels.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Funk band.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO
dialogues.text: The Funkateers.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Is that even a word? Gus and Uncle Taki eat, play with Alexander the Great car

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Look, Alexander the Great conquering Mesopotamia. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TAKI
dialogues.text: Speaking of, be gentle with your bride tonight. Uncle Taki and Gus laugh their heads off. Then -- through the side window, Gus sees Nick pull up. And his brother PANOS, 70's, gets out of the car. Shocked, Gus looks at Uncle Taki and Ian.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: That’s my brother, Panos! (scowls) I don’t like surprises.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TAKI
dialogues.text: Gus, the kids, they did it for you. Uncle Taki takes a BOTTLE OF OUZO and SHOT GLASSES, goes to meet Panos. Gus is upset.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Gus, the family pooled their airline points.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Ian, you don’t know this, you’re not successful like me. When you do well, you become a sign of hope for the optimist. But to the pessimist, you represent the stench of their own failure. Those people hate you for their life choices.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I send him money, he sends it back. Ian gestures for Gus to come with him outside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. NICK’S HOUSE - SAME DAY Ian follows as Gus comes out to greet his brother Panos. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: (cordial, stiff) Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on your wedding today.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Thank you. A moment goes by. It’s nice. Taki hands the ouzo and glasses to Nick, leaves with the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: TAKI
dialogues.text: Panos, I’1l put your suitcase in the guest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you have a big house. Suddenly Gus bellows.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that?! Ian does a double-take. Panos quickly turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean! Ian gets out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: My son works hard, he deserves a house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don’t?!

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: You could have had this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I chose to stay and work in our country! I didn’t abandon her then and I won’t now! I’m a real Greek!

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I’m a real Greek too! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trying to change the subject, Nick holds up the tray of o

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Let’s drink! Nick pours ouzo. Panos takes a glass. Nick urges Gus to take one too. He does. Panos raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the homeland.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: To the Patritha. And the drachma. They drink. Suddenly Panos and Gus hug. Nick pours another. Then--

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To you, Panos, my brother. That goes a long way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you, Costa, my brother! Ian raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: To you, Nick, my brother. Nick touched, hugs Ian.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: To you, Ian, my brother. They all drink. Gus nudges Panos about Ian.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: (in Greek, subtitled) He’s okay for a Xeno. Ian nudges Gus.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (in perfect Greek, subtitled) You're okay for a grouchy old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a bowl, Toula runs from the kitchen to the hall.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Paris, you want keftethes? Toula puts the bowl on the hall table. She opens her purs to transfer lipstick and her phone to a cocktail purse, l at the Find Your Ancestry letter. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Mom? Toula turns. Paris is at the top of the stairs. She is dressed, her ha and makeup are subtle and fresh... she is ready for prom. Paris comes down the stairs. And, at the base of the stai

dialogues.speaker: PARIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (wryly) You’re not on the Prom Chaperone committee?

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Oh, they asked but I said no. (pause) Why, do you need me to be?!

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: God, no!

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Okay then. (pause) Am I always so close, you see your shadow as two people?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: (gently) Yeah. Toula finally gets it. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: I'm stepping back now. Go and have a great time. Tonight... and to college in New York. And even though I’ve taken a step back, I’1l always be right here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Paris can’t believe what she’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Thank you. Paris and Toula nod in quiet understanding. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s Bennett! Toula and Paris run around panicking. Toula opens the door: Bennett is there, crowded by Nick, Angelo, male grandchildren. And Maria in her wedding dres

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BENNETT'S LIMO/STREET
dialogues.text: Bennett and Paris get driven to prom. Bennett rubs his ne

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Your Uncle hugs hard.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Paris plays with her wrist corsage, tries to be cool. Bennett is nervous too.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Was your grandma in a wedding dress?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Yep. A long pause Paris refuses to fill.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Where’s the rest of your family?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Uh, who?

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: I saw a bigger group at the College Fair. Paris remembers, cringes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're like my family.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Except mine is bigger, louder, more oily and in your face than anyone’s.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: No way, no Greek family is bigger, louder, more oily and in your face than my Greek family. A beat. A long one.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: You're Greek?

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Yeah! Unsure how she feels, Paris looks out the window. Then grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding his tux, Ian sees Rodney pull up in his car, goes him. Rodney opens his trunk, pulls out a funeral wreath.

dialogues.speaker: RODNEY
dialogues.text: I will have to return this. Rodney attaches a hand-written ribbon: Happy Wedding Day! Ian looks at his dad, healthy, content.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad... do you ever need anything?

dialogues.speaker: RODNEY
dialogues.text: Such as? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I mean, from me? Do you ever need me to do anything, or want to talk about--

dialogues.speaker: RODNEY
dialogues.text: Is someone ill? Ian shakes his head ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: No Dad. It’s just... If you ever need anything, call. A long moment. It’s the deepest they’ve ever gone. Rodney takes it in. Nods, touched.

dialogues.speaker: RODNEY
dialogues.text: You got it. Rodney gets back in his car. Toula runs from the house.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I have to head to prom for a minute to make sure the Chaperones aren’t drinking.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Oh no. Don’t spy on Paris.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: She told you I....? Okay. Ian starts to pull out. Maria leans out her window:

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Toula, what time is it?! Why aren’t the limousines here? Toula looks at Angelo.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Did we book limousines? Angelo panics and runs to fix it.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call Mike!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMAN whistles, stops traffic: THREE POLICE CARS wi SIRENS drive through.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Mike is at the wheel. Maria and Aunt Voula are in the bac

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I got this!

dialogues.speaker: I/E. POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: In the back of the other car: dressed up Toula, Athena and Nick, look queasy at the ride.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Mike drives like a maniac, in the back Aunt Voula calms Maria.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I’ll bet Gus is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: In the back of the third car: Gus, Uncle Taki and Uncle Panos drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE SQUAD cars are parked outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CONGREGATION is seated. Rocking a new hairstyle, Mana-Yiayia comes in with Nikki. EVERYONE murmurs their approval of Mana-Yiayia’s hair. Ni preens. At the back, Toula is calling Ian, gets voice mail. She s Nick looking at a pew, worried: Gus, Uncle Taki and Panos in their ill-fitting glitter-tuxedos, are drunk. The congregation is horrified, some struggle to not laugh

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC.
dialogues.text: Bennett and Paris drink soda, laugh their heads off.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: No, wait, wait, is the lump still on the back of your Thea’s neck?!

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: She had it removed, but she says she misses her twin. She goes- Paris rubs the back of her neck and frowns wistfully.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “I should never have had that beebopsy.” Paris and Bennett laugh.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: I have an aunt who talks like she always has a piece of lamb stuck in her throat. (imitates hoarsely, with Greek accent) “Bennett, Bennett, say hhhhello to your parents, if you see my daughter, tell her I’m hhhhup- stairs.” They laugh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, why aren’t you in Greek Club?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Every day of my life is Greek Club. Why, what do you do there? Bennett shrugs, points to MANY of DIFFERENT ETHNICITIES.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Same as they do in the Lebanese Club, Italian Club, Chinese Club. We eat and make fun of our parents. Clifford runs over, looking a bit drunk. Tiahn is annoyed

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD
dialogues.text: Where’s the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Hhhup-stairs. Bennett cracks up, looks at her fondly.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: You look nice. Paris smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Thank you. You do too. Bennett grins, leans in to her.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT
dialogues.text: Hey, thanks for asking me to prom. Paris smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BENNETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Yeah! They run toward the dance floor. PULL BACK: Ian is watching. He takes a moment. Then he takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toula runs to her seat. The organ music starts, EVERYONE STANDS. Nick walks Maria walk down the aisle. Maria is ecstatic, finally having a wedding. As Nick and Maria pass Rodney and Harriet, they spit on Maria. Harriet giggles to Rodney.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIET
dialogues.text: I’ve been waiting a long time to do that! In the front pew, Toula smiles wide, trying to keep her m from noticing Gus has been drinking. Then, Maria sees Gus giggling and her face drops. Maria abruptly turns, runs into an open room on the side. Everyone gasps.

dialogues.speaker: ATHENA
dialogues.text: Toula, do something! Toula runs after her mom, with Athena following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toula and Athena push open the velvet curtain and enter t find Maria sitting in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: He’s not taking this seriously. Toula pulls the curtain, looks out: Mana-Yiayia cuffs Gus Panos and they stop giggling.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: He is now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: What am I getting married for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Congregation gets antsy. Where’s Maria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What’s happening? Maria is pacing.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Who says a woman has to be married?

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Um, you. All our lives.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Because in my day, women were raised to be married! But is that it? I’ve been single these last months, and I’ve been thinking, maybe I could have traveled and cured diseases and wrote poetry and had adventure in my life! Instead of being saddled with a grouchy old man yelling every morning for his mineral oil so his bowels won’t get backed up!! Nikki blanches.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You need my ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki runs toward Aunt Voula as the Congregation hears: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARIA, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What do men want? A companion or a nurse?! Worried, Gus looks at Panos beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Followed by Nikki, Aunt Voula comes in.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: Gus is a good man.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: He’s a crazy man.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria tries to take off her veil.

dialogues.speaker: ATHENA
dialogues.text: Toula, do something!

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: I’m trying to not fix everything!

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: That’s not working.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: That’s not working.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: That’s not working. Panos pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria, I remember, fifty years ago, Gus was so happy because he had found someone who was brave like him, to come to America and live an adventure. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember his hopeful expression... and he has the same look on his face today. That actually affects Maria. She remembers.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I was brave.... Maria mulls it all over. MARIA (CONT’D) Maybe my adventure was to make a family. Being married is not for everyone, but... I guess it worked out okay for me... (ponders ) I think it’s been a good life. As Maria thinks, Panos looks at Aunt Voula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re still hot.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: I know. Get out. Panos ducks out. Maria starts to get up. Athena Toula. Maria looks out at Gus. He looks so cute.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Dad said he can’t sleep without you snoring.... Maria sharply looks back.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I don’t snore. He snores.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Okay. Then, Maria looks serious.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: He can’t sleep? 92 looks at Toula nods. Maria looks back at Gus again, and finally... exhales. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARIA (CONT’D) Ah, you know what? I love him. Your father may be crazy but at least I’m not a blood relative of his. (realizing) You are. Sorry! Toula’s face drops. Maria cracks herself up, takes her bouquet from the table MARIA (CONT’D) Okay, let’s do this thing. They all turn to the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toula, Maria, Athena, Aunt Voula and Nikki scurry through alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toula, Maria, Athena, Aunt Voula and Nikki run in the bac Nick runs to join them. Athena, Nikki and Aunt Voula go to their seats, Aunt Voul gives Gus the thumbs up. Gus gives a grateful look to Pan

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Thank you. Panos beams back. EVERYONE stands again. Nick walks Maria down the aisle. Maria gets to Gus.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Say something nice.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I missed you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Good enough. (then) I missed you too. And, you snore, not me. Gus laughs, takes her hands, kisses them. They smile at each other like teenagers. The Priest begins. Toula stays at the back, dials Ian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the church, Toula listens to Ian’s cell ri

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hello? Toula turns, Ian is smiling in his tuxedo. Toula hugs him

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything go smoothly?

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Nope. Ian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you see Paris? Ian nods. Toula understands. They both sigh. Ian looks past Toula at her parents’ wedding.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: So they’re doing it huh? THEIR POV: The Priest is doing the ceremony. It’s beautiful. Toula relaxes. She turns and looks at Ian. And finally se him.

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Hi. They both smile. It’s been a long time since they’ve real looked at each other. Then, Toula whispers....

dialogues.speaker: TOULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you marry me? Ian is surprised. He thinks she’s kidding.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Yes. But Toula is serious.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Yes. Ian softens.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Toula reaches into the centerpiece, pulls out daisies int makeshift head wreaths, similar to the ones Gus and Maria wearing. Toula pulls off a ribbon, they join it to the wreaths on their heads, holding it in place, mirroring the ceremony the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris and Bennett are dancing to a fast song. It’s fun. T song changes to a slow one. Bennett holds his hands out t Paris. She tentatively enters his embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the church altar: Gus and Maria walk around the altar three times. At the back of the church: Toula and Ian walk around the table three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bennett sweetly kisses Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceremony ends. Gus sweetly kisses Maria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian sweetly kisses Toula. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEK MUSIC emanates from the back yard and fills the str The THREE SQUAD CARS block the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND PLAYS GREEK MUSIC. THE FAMILY celebrates and dances. Athena’s sons are the waiters and bring out delicious MOUSSAKA, PASTICHIO and LAMB CHOPS. The food bubbles and glistens in the moonlight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE EAT with gusto. Ian brings Toula a glass of wine, they hold each

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Look what you did! Toula leans into him.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: We did. They smile.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. I wasn’t avoiding you. Honestly. It’s just, I’ve been a mom for so long, I don’t remember how to be us. Ian nods, he understands, and pulls her tight.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. We'll be together, we could take a vacation....

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: We could adopt a baby... Ian surprised, looks at Toula, then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: We'll talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: (teasing) Think it over. (tiny pause) Did you think it over? They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon, we can do anything, we're newlyweds...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we are! They kiss. 97 other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rodney and Harriet lead the Greek dancing line. Athena, Yianni, Nick, Ilaria, MANY follow. Maria walks around greeting and thanking everyone, making sure they’re eating and enjoying themselves. MEN do ouzo shots. Costa and Aristotle do Gatorade shots. Angelo sees Aunt Voula, Nikki and Uncle Taki heading towa Patrick and him. He stops them.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO
dialogues.text: Come on, Ma, let’s go dance. But Nikki waves over Patrick, who comes to them, putting his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I'm Patrick. Nice to finally meet you. Aunt Voula smiles wide, pats his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: You look Greek.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TAKI
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: That’s ok, don’t apologize. Nikki loops her arm through Angelo’s.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s dance. Aunt Voula walks with Patrick to the dance area.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT VOULA
dialogues.text: Okay, all my life, I had a mole on my tummy, it was shaped like Mykonos, oh, I have so much to tell you-- Uncle Taki puts his arm around Angelo. Across the dance floor, Toula and Ian are thrilled to see Paris and Bennett come into the party. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Toula sees Paris holding Bennett’s hand. Paris looks over at her parents, and waves. Toula and Ian wave back. Then take each other’s hands. Costa, Aristotle, the male cousins descend on Bennett and take him to the ground. Nick steps in and pushes them all back so Paris can pass. Theodore winks at Paris as she and Bennett go to sit with Mana-Yiayia, who keeps an eye on THREE LITTLE KIDS sleepi on chairs put together around the table. Toula sees Gus is with Maria at their table, the timing i right. She turns to Ian.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: I have to do something. Toula reaches into her purse, takes out the letter from F Your Ancestry. Concerned, Ian follows.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad, here, the letter came. Toula hands Gus the letter. He looks at her, then opens i And reads.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Ah-ha, I knew it! Gus signals for the band to stop playing. Everyone looks:

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone! This document here, is official! I am related to Alexander the Great!

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Of course! EVERYONE is impressed, and claps. Nick stands up.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, that means we all are!! Now EVERYONE goes nuts celebrating. Ian turns to Toula, smiles and leans in, whispering. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Did you write that letter?

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Yup. Toula sees Gus celebrating with Panos, plus his cronies f the Rehab Center: Kaveh, Pim and Baird. The Band plays again, Toula and Ian join the line and dan in a circle. The FAMILY follows, passing Athena, Nikki, Ilaria, Marian and Jennie as they pose for a picture, pulling each other necks back.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANTHI
dialogues.text: Pull. FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GREEK MUSIC is loud. Mrs. White, Marge and Edie, stand in front of the Portoka home. Their body stance is a tad wistful. The door opens, Toula lets out the dog, sees the women...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WHITE
dialogues.text: It’s loud. Toula takes a moment to think. Then--

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Do you want to join us? Mrs. White, Marge and Edie look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: EDIE
dialogues.text: Well, I could eat a little something.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty. The women walk toward Toula. Toula waves them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris sits on her bed, happily looking around her sparse room. Just a New York University poster is on the wall. Her roommate, ELIZABETH, 18, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: I’m Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: Paris. A moment goes by. Then....

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Um, are they staying? WIDEN to reveal: Toula, Ian, Maria, Gus, Aunt Voula, Uncl Taki, Nick, Ilaria, Athena, Yianni, Angelo and Nikki are there. Toula realizes they are staring.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: We're going. The family quickly leaves gifts, (Gus’s is Windex), kisse Paris, and they go. Ian pulls Toula toward the door. Toula looks back once at Paris. And smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TOULA
dialogues.text: Bye. Toula closes the door. FADE OUT.
